p: This article summarises evidence of the impact of climate change on health in South Africa and highlights specific effects on vulnerable populations. The review covers the direct impacts on health through extreme events and temperature increases, but also the more indirect impacts mediated through natural systems (for example infectious diseases) and through social vulnerabilities [ 12]. While several narrative reviews have summed the impacts of climate change on health in South Africa [ 13, 14, 15, 16], there is a need to review more up to date literature and to collate evidence in a systematic manner.
